Denizens of the Underworld introduces 165 new cards to Call of Cthulhu (three copies each of fifty-five individual cards), roughly two-thirds of which provide members of the Syndicate a host of new names for their rosters, as well as deadly tools, and clever tricks. Additionally, the expansion introduces a new Ancient One and new characters and Tactic events for all of the game’s other factions.
147711.name: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game – Denizens of the Underworld
boardgameexpansion: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game
boardgamefamily: Call of Cthulhu: The Card Game (LCG)

147712.description:
Die Zwerge: Mit vereinten Kräften, an expansion for the Die Zwerge board game, gives players new scenarios, specifically 14 scenario cards: (6x Stage A, 2x Stage B, 6x Stage C)so that completely new endings are possible. This expansion also includes eight new adventures, five threat cards, and two equipment cards.

It contains the cards from the earlier Albae expansion.
147712.name: The Dwarves: Combined Might

147713.name: Pest Patrol
147713.description:
User Summary

Grab a can of bug spray and defend yourself from 40 swarming waves of insects. There are the nice butterflies and snails but watch out for the worms, spiders, fleas and beetles in this arcade shooter similar to Space Invaders.

147714.name: Roach Hotel
147714.description:
User Summary

Get your feet ready to stamp out the roaches before there is no vacancy at the Roach Hotel. Stamp out 10 spiders to clear out the hotel. But watch out! their bite hurts.

147715.name: Captain Cuckoo
147715.description:
User Summary

Play through the early days of Captain Cuckoo, Superhero extraordinaire!

147716.description:
Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game is a tabletop miniature wargame based on the humorous 1962 Mars Attacks trading card series from Topps in which aliens from Mars try to take over the planet of the humans — that is, Earth!

The game allows two (or more) players to take on the role of Martian invaders or the human resistance, then battle for the fate of the planet! You set your armies on the table board and move units of aliens or human soldiers to fight to achieve goals, either by defending your position or vaporizing your opponents. This tactical tabletop game features rules by veteran designer Jake Thornton and a host of stunning Mantic miniatures that can be used straight out of the box or painted to add even more character to your games.

- Martian Mayhem: Mars Attacks is full of wacky events and cinematic action made possible by the simple set of game mechanics that are very easy to learn, and by the game's Event Card deck.

- Story Driven Action: Follow our heroes during the battle of Greenville with fun playable scenarios, each with their own objectives: eliminate the enemy, capture the intelligence - escape the Martian invaders!

- Easy to play: Much like a board game, Mars Attacks is played on a gaming mat made of squares and players take it in turn to activate their models, choosing whether to move, shoot or fight in hand-to-hand combat.

- Simple Dice Mechanics: Shooting and hand-to-hand combat is made easy by rolling eight-sided dice to decide whether a weapon has hit its target, or whether the opponent manages to dodge out of the way.

- Highly Tactical: move a figure out from behind cover and you’re likely to get your model killed. Similarly, ganging up on an opponent or making use of a figure’s special abilities could be the difference between making a clean kill, or engaging in a frantic game of cat and mouse!

All of this is detailed in the comic-book sized Mars Attacks – The Miniatures Game rulebook which also includes a number of playable missions. These battles are fought in Greenville, a town brought to life through our stunning modular ruined scenery. You will fight amongst the devastated town capturing objectives such as intelligence and weapons - or with the sole goal of eliminating your enemy.

Whether you’re a veteran gamer or new to the hobby, you’ll be able to enjoy the fun of Mars Attacks, making it a game suitable for all ages.
147716.name: Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game
boardgameexpansion: Mars Attacks: The Miniature Game – Attack from space
Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Extermination
Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Humanity Resists
Mars Attacks: The Miniatures Game – Martian Dredd
boardgamepodcastepisode: Podcast: Diógenes Busca Juego 03 – Guerra de Miniaturas

147717.name: Card Sharks
147717.description:
User Summary

Based on the TV game show of the same name.

Play against a computer contestant or a real one as you try to predict how people have answered survey questions. Guess right and go to your row of five cards. Predict if the next card is going to be higher or lower than the previous. Clear all five cards to win the match and win 2 matches go to the Money Cards with a chance to win the big money!

147719.description:
Westerly is a co-operative adventure game of westward expansion. Players select a character at the beginning of the game and try to get them to California in one piece...literally. In Westerly things can go from bad to worse in a matter of minutes and your character can be injured, maimed, left to die by the group or maybe just eaten by a bear or even your own party. Ayup that's right I'm talking about cannibalism. Fear not if it all goes wrong you can rejoin the party as a different character that hops into the wagon at the next town.

The game involves strategy and co-operation combined with a tongue in cheek approach to all the horrible things that can happen along the perilous route out west.

Tiles are played in order to navigate the group to California. The game space is split into three different tracks North, South and West. Encounter cards are drawn depending on which track the group is currently in. The group must then work together to select the best way to deal with the encounter and either reap the benefits or pay the consequences of their selection.

The road is treacherous filled with bandits, angry natives, predators, environmental dangers, and the list goes on. Westerly is comedic one minute and brutal the next. You never know what the exact party make up will be or what route you will have to take to go west.

Westerly is all about the story of you and your friends trying their best to make it out west and all the ridiculous things that can go wrong along the way. If ya manage to get there you will absolutely have a wild story to tell.
147719.name: Westerly

147721.description:
Everybunny knows that rabbits love the countryside — and carrots, of course! The best carrots of all grow between the train tracks, but you have to keep an eye out for trains! Roll the dice and hop your rabbit to the best carrot patch; as long as you don't need to flee out of the path of the train, you can happily nibble away. Chomp, chomp, chomp...

In Karnickel, each player places his rabbit on the circular train track made of eight interchangeable tiles, sets the train engine on its start space, then takes turns rolling the custom dice. After you roll, set any die that shows the "train" out of play, then count up how many times each of the player colors appears on the remaining dice; you must move one of the rabbits (yours or another player's) clockwise around the track the full number of spaces. You then pass the rabbit dice to the next player. Players take turns, each time rolling only the dice passed to them and hopping the rabbits from tile to tile, trying to land on the tiles where they will be able to collect the most carrots.

When a player rolls only trains, the rabbit hopping has to stop as the train is ready to move! That player rerolls all seven dice, counts up the number of trains rolled, then moves the train that many spaces around the track. Every rabbit on a tile that the train moves through is scared away by the engine and hops off the track, failing to collect any carrots this time. All rabbits still on the track after the train moves — either because the train didn't reach them or because they were on one of the two tunnel tiles — get to grab 1, 2 or 3 carrots...or maybe lose one — exploding carrots are a risk!

Everyone then hops back onto the track, and the next player rolls all the dice to start a new round of play. Whoever has the most carrots when one player has at least eight carrots wins!
147721.name: Karnickel

147722.name: Worlds of Magic
147722.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – IN BETA




This game is in Beta and has not been fully released yet.




Welcome to Worlds of Magic! A new 4X turn-based strategy game set in a fantasy universe developed by the experienced teams of Wastelands Interactive and Lucid Dreamers. Worlds of Magic combines the outstanding features of the greatest classic 4X games with innovative, exciting, and unique new features.

Source: The Developer Website.

147723.description:
Step into the beloved fantasy world of J.R.R. Tolkien, continue the journey out of Rivendell, and avoid the fearsome Nazgûl as you accompany Frodo on a desperate journey while the fate of all Middle-earth hangs in the balance!

The Road Darkens is the second Lord of the Rings Saga Expansion for The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game. Its 165 cards introduce three new scenarios to the game, along with two heroes, twenty-seven player cards (three copies each of nine different player cards), eight boons, and seven burdens. Together, these cards allow you to immerse yourself in some of the most pivotal moments of Middle-earth's Third Age as you join Frodo Baggins and his companions on their all-important quest!

New Boon and Burden cards (eight and seven, respectively) ensure your actions have consequences, while a new Easy Mode allows you to tailor the game to your individual play style and skill level.
147723.name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Road Darkens
boardgameexpansion: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
boardgamefamily: Lord of the Rings: The Card Game (LCG)

147724.name: Sleep with the Fishes
147724.description:
From publisher blurb:

The merman mafia had been content to operate out of the safety of Stark Lake, dabbling in minor crime in Stark City.

But no more! The Atlantean gangster Krachla has captured a lakeside neighborhood in a forcefield, flooded it and mutated the residents into water-breathers (who he is holding hostage to ensure the non-interfence of the authorities.)

He plans on ruling this sub-aquatic neighborhood as sovereign nation with himself as dictator for life.

The police and army are powerless to stop him -- Can your heroes save the day from this Aquatic Al Capone?

147725.name: Foresight
147725.description:
From publisher blurb:

FORESIGHT!!

With the gift of precognition, Foresight sees what you'll do before you do it! A sinister schemer with a sixth-sense, he's cast his shadow across your city and plans to take out your heroes. Can they stop him? He's seen the future and it doesn't look good for them.

147726.name: Stark City Visitor Brochure
147726.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Kickstarter for the new ICONS setting - Stark City - has been successful and we're busy putting the book(s) together for your enjoyment.

To celebrate - we're releasing ANOTHER preview - this free tourist brochure of Stark City. Written by and with an awesome map by Steff Worthington.

147727.name: Laughing Boy
147727.description:
From publisher blurb:

To celebrate, Stark City Games is going to release during the Kickstarter some profiles of heroes found within the upcoming setting material for ICONS, beginning with Laughing Boy, a hero found in Geartown - a run-down industrial section of the city.

Also, a peek at the Hero Turf rules found in 'Welcome to Stark City' the first supplement of the Stark City setting material for ICONS.

147728.name: Doc Chimp
147728.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stark City Games is going to release during the Kickstarter some profiles of heroes found within the upcoming setting material for ICONS. Continuing with a hero found in Tesla Industrial Park - a cutting-edge techonological district designed to make Stark City a Town on the Edge of Tomorrow!

Also, you'll get a peek at all of the districts of Stark City and a taste of Tesla Park's Background!

147729.name: Pin Ball
147729.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stark City Games is going to release during the Kickstarter some profiles of heroes found within the upcoming setting material for ICONS. Continuing with Pinball, an amnesiac hero found in the Silver District - the modern center of the metropolitan marvel that is Stark City!

Also, you'll get a peek at some of Doctor Comics' notes for the Silver District, as well as a closer look at one of the finest restaurants in Stark City, "No Regrets"!

147730.name: Komodo
147730.description:
From publisher blurb:

Stark City Games is going to release the final profile of heroes found within the upcoming setting material for ICONS. Finishing with Komodo, the bodyguard and lab assistant to Doc Chimp, hero of Tesla Industrial Park - the science and technological industrial complex for Stark City!

Included is a sneak peek at many of the primary organizations within Tesla Industrial Park, including basic ways to integrate the organizations into your home game!

147731.name: Ascoola 90-talet
147731.description:
Swedish trivia game (translation: "the super cool 90's). With questions relating to (predominately Swedish) 90's pop culture in TV, music and film.

The players divide into teams or compete individually. It is a party game where having fun is more important than keeping score, though one correct answer equals one point.

147732.name: Muzicando
147732.description:
Muzicando is a card game about the rainbow colors and about musical instruments and notes. The deck consist of 56 cards 8 for each color of the rainbow. 7 cards have the musical notes from DO to SI and the eigth card is a representing a special personality like one of the followings:
Guido d'Arezzo, Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart, Franz Liszt, Ludwig van Beethoven, Frederic Francois Chopin, Johann Sebastian Bach and Niccolo Paganini.
Guido d'Arezzo was a music theorist of the Medieval era. He is regarded as the inventor of modern musical notation (staff notation) that replaced neumatic notation and thus he is the most powerfull card in the game causing all the players to skip a turn when played giving an aditional turn to the one who played it. The other personalities are some of the best composers of clasical music and when played are causing some players to skip a turn,

The main goal in this game is to be the first to get rid of all the cards. The mechanism to get rid of them is to put them on the table in turns in some ways that depends of an auction made in the first phase of the game. The players can bid for on of the 4 ways to display the cards on the table. These are Sarabanda, Glissando, Parada and Muzicando.

147733.name: Tjejmiddag
147733.description:
Swedish party game (translation "Girls' dinner").

A simple trivia game with 400 questions on topics like the perfect boyfriend, fun memories, sex and much more.

The game is more about having fun than keeping score, but as is customary in these types of games, one correct answer scores one point.

147735.description:
From the Avalanche Press website:

The liberation of France began with the Allied invasion on D-Day, 6 June 1944. From Sword, Gold, and Juno beaches, British Army troops fought their way across the hedgerows and rolling green hills, driving back Hitler’s Wehrmacht and SS forces. Fierce German resistance, featuring skilled use of tanks on the defensive, resulted in the loss of huge numbers of men and machines - but no loss of will. The promise of 1940 would be fulfilled.

Liberation 1944 is a complete game in the Panzer Grenadier series covering the fierce struggles of His Majesty’s forces through Operations Overlord, Goodwood, and Bluecoat. There are 41 new scenarios by designer Mike Perryman. Four new mapboards by artist Guy Riessen show the hedgerows, hills, towns and farmland of France. There are 517 playing pieces: 352 combat units and 165 markers.

Both sides bring swarms of tanks to your game table: Shermans and Fireflies, Cromwell and Churchills match up with Panthers, Panzer IV's, and Tigers.
147735.name: Panzer Grenadier: Liberation 1944

147736.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Firefly: The Game - Breakin' Atmo introduces fifty new cards to the game: 25 job cards and 25 supply cards. New jobs present new challenges for captains and their crews with payouts based on their skill levels. The additional supply cards offer new resourceful crew members for hire and specialized gear to help you pull off the big scores.
147736.name: Firefly: The Game – Breakin' Atmo
boardgamepodcastepisode: MN 0012 Firefly the Game - The Promos and Expansions

147737.description:
Players assume the roles of aspiring chefs who are competing for the head chef position at the swanky Burger Blitz restaurant. Battle your way to the top by attacking other chef's reputations, enlisting the services of food minions, making magic in the kitchen, and getting your hands dirty by taking the plate to speed up your burger-making skills.

Burger Blitz's main mechanic is press-your-luck dice rolling. What you roll determines 6 different bonuses you can earn that round - Reputation, Burger Ingredients, Pepper, Mayo, Attack, and Tips.

In addition to dice, there are 24 minion cards which players can purchase. These minions give players permanent bonuses they can use every turn.

Finally there are magic cards. Magic cards are earned every time a player completes a full burger. These cards are powerful but can only be used once. Play a mayo token with a magic card to boost the effects even more.

Burger Blitz is easy enough for young children to learn but has enough depth and strategy to entertain seasoned gamers. Included in the rulebook are several variants recommended for more casual or more cutthroat games.
147737.name: Burger Blitz!

147739.description:
“Can a single voice still make a difference? Probably not, but that won’t stop me from trying. What GRNDL does to the environment is nothing short of criminal.”
–Tallie Perrault

Fear and Loathing is the fifth Data Pack in the "Spin Cycle" for Android: Netrunner. The futuristic world of Android: Netrunner is one of vertiginous discrepancies between achievement and poverty. The megacorps that have redefined humanity with the development of custom genetics, bioroid manufacturing, and mind-machine interfacting are at least partially responsible for stabilizing social policies that mire countless masses in overcrowded, unsanitary living conditions. In the shadows of the megacorporations’ towering corporate headquarters, the vast majority experience mundane desperations, fear for their jobs, loathe their limited social status, and fight a daily war for survival.

The sixty new cards of Fear and Loathing (three copies each of twenty individual cards) translate this dichotomous existence to your games of Android: Netrunner. On the one hand, you have powerful and exploitive business entities like GRNDL, a subsidiary of the Weyland Consortium, and on the other, you have the beaten down and fearful masses. But there are other categories, too, and while many people may be driven to silence, the game’s Runners and other spirited individuals, like the investigative reporter Tallie Perrault, are driven to action.
147739.name: Android: Netrunner – Fear and Loathing

147740.name: Tripods!
147740.description:
Tripods! is a competitive, strategy survival game set during a Martian invasion of Victorian London. Two to four players take control of a number of playing pieces representing the populace of the city and are trying to score as many points as possible by the end of the game. Points are awarded for helping citizens escape, keeping them alive until the Martians are destroyed and killing the Martian war machines.

The inhabitants of London have no say over the greater workings of the Martian invasion or the government's response to it, relying on garbled rumours and reports to keep them informed. Game plays out over a fixed narrative of eight 'Headlines', which reveal the next stage of the invasion and events within the narrative are controlled by a 'Tidings' deck which instructs the players how to manipulate the invaders and the military who are trying to counter the threat. The Tidings deck also contains the Red Creeper, which spread across the board as the game progresses. Once consumed by the alien plant a space is no longer safe from the Martian's terrible Death Ray. These Tidings can be manipulated by players through the use of five Character cards, each of which has a special ability and each of which can be used only once per game so timing must be chosen carefully.

Escape from London is achieved by leaving the board from one of five stations or the docks. As Headlines are revealed these escape routes begin closing and as the Martians grow more prolific, the Red Creeper spreads, the available military units dwindle and escape routes shut so the tensions build and players begin to turn on each other to compete for the few remaining avenues of exodus.

147741.name: Moose Hunt
147741.description:
Moose Hunt game made by Chaffee and Selchow (later Selchow & Righter) is a typical roll and move board game with wonderful graphics depicting a hunter and Indian killing moose.

The first player who crosses the "start" line wins the game.

147742.name: Portfolio eines Drachen: Dunkelzahns Geheimnisse
147742.description:
User description

German Translation of Portfolio of a Dragon: Dunkelzahn's Secrets . The German version was released for Shadowrun 3, eight years after the original publication.

147743.name: NHL 14
videogamehonor: 2013 Game Critics Best Sports Game of the Year Winner
2013 Spike (VGX) Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2014 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee
147743.description:
NHL 14 is an ice hockey video game developed by EA Canada and published by EA Sports. It is the 23rd installment of the NHL series and was released on September 10, 2013 in North America, and September 13, 2013 in Europe as well as Australia and New Zealand.

NHL 14 has overhauls to two game engines, based on other sports titles developed by EA Canada. The collision physics are now powered by the same core technology behind the FIFA Player Impact Engine. For more realistic fights, the game employs the new Enforcer Engine based on the Fight Night series. In addition, the True Performance Skating engine got some more improvements, and the game has a new deking system. The game's Be a Pro career mode now has off-the-ice interactions to dictate the player's overall legacy. NHL 14 will also feature a modernized version of NHL '94, called NHL '94 Anniversary mode, featuring current rosters and updated graphics to commemorate the game's 20th anniversary.

Source: Wikipedia, "NHL 14", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

147744.name: DNA/DOA
147744.description:
User description

Release of DNA/DOA for Shadowrun, 2nd edition. This updated version was only released in Italy by Nexus and in Germany by Fanpro.

147745.name: Quinquereme
147745.description:
Quinquereme is a light dice game loosely connected to the navies of ancient Rome. Each player has to complete twelve scoring categories in any order, e.g. three of a kind for numbers 1 to 6, four of a kind or a straight of consecutive numbers. Dice may be rolled up to three times per turn. Scoring may vary, dependent on how many throws a player has already used during his/her turn.

Three, four and five of a kind are referred as Triremes, Quadriremes and Quinqueremes. Players unable to assign their result to any of the available score categories have to 'sink' one of their ships (i.e. mark zero points in a category).

After all categories have been filled, points are added and the player with the most points wins.
The game uses standard six-sided dice with roman numerals from I to VI.

147746.name: The Good, the Bad, and the Hunky
147746.description:
[Taken from the site text and submitter comments.]
The supervillain Stargazer has a plan. He’s getting old and villainy just isn’t as rewarding anymore, and he’s come up with a way to make everything better. He just needs a hand from some fellow supervillains.

The superheroine Chainsaw Sue has a plan, too. Her plan is to chainsaw supervillains. And disturbers of the peace. And pretty much anybody else who annoys her. Chainsaw Sue is not the most heroic of superheroines.

Throw in an Occupy Wall Street protest and a fashion show and you have all the ingredients for a night full of scheming, hilarity, dismemberment, and demon possession for Better Angels. Just add player characters.

Requires Better Angels to play.

boardgameimplementation: Super Fantasy: Night of the Badly Dead
147747.description:
Super Fantasy is the first hack'n'slash board game in which up to six players take on the roles of brave and unique heroes. During each game, players embark on tricky and mighty quests into ever-changing dangerous caves and dungeons swarmed with monsters and terrible creatures that try to slaughter them, while heroes try to gain treasures as well as better equipment in order to complete the missions.

Since hordes of monsters repeatedly cross the path of our heroes, bloody clashes are inevitable in order to achieve victory! That is why Super Fantasy uses a simple yet unique dice-based system. Players have a pool of six dice to roll that they manage according to the action they want to perform (such as movement, attack, etc.) and its effectiveness. Each face of the dice shows either a 1, 2 or the Special Power symbol and the sum of the results shown represents the effectiveness of the action performed by the heroes. Every time the Special Power symbol occurs, the hero can choose to charge one of his abilities; once fully charged, the hero can unleash its power against the enemies!

Super Fantasy features double-sided modular board pieces for creating countless scenarios combinations, six mighty heroes and three unique and powerful abilities for each hero, throwing players into a fast-paced world in which anything can happen!
147747.name: Super Fantasy: Ugly Snouts Assault

147750.name: Slalom
147750.description:
Slalom is a paper-and-pencil game for "any number" of players. Each player has a sheet with a point grid and a slalom course through it. A turn consists of rolling the dice and choosing one of three movement options. Players must pass each gate on the correct side.

Players mark off "seconds" for each die roll and mark off more for deviating from the ideal slalom line and for brushing a gate. The player marking off the fewest seconds wins.

The game was published in the November/December 1978 issue of GAMES.

147751.name: Penny Patterns
147751.description:
Penny Patterns is played with thirty-six pennies on a board made up of blue and red circles. On each turn the active player flips a penny and places it in a red (inner) circle if it comes up tails and a blue (outer) circle if it comes up heads. Placing in a blue circle entitles a player to go again.

The object is to form symmetrical patterns of at least four pennies, and all the pennies on the board must be used. A point is scored for each axis of symmetry in such a pattern.

The game can be played competitively, but can also be played solitaire, with the object being to beat one's previous best score.

The game was published in the November/December 1978 issue of GAMES.

147752.name: Drag Race
147752.description:
Drag Race is a paper-and-pencil guessing game for two players. Players alternate choosing the letter A, B, or C (darkening a half-circle to indicate their choice) and guessing what their opponent has chosen.

Player 1 chooses a letter and Player 2 guesses what they chose. If Player 2 guesses correctly nothing happens. If Player 2 guesses incorrectly Player 1 gets to darken scoring squares (representing speed), with the number depending on how late in the game it is (the later, the more points scored). The object is to score as many squares as possible.

The game was published in the September/October 1978 issue of GAMES.

boardgamecompilation: Skirmish! The Scrambles plus expansions pack
147753.description:
New allies have come to the somewhat silly monsters. Mage adventures are getting more and more overpowered, so the monsters try to nerf them by recruiting guys that are immune. But if both sides recruit the same, nothing will change. We're still looking for someone who can inform the monsters of that… in the meantime, they're still fighting!

This 4 cards expansion add one new monster "Gazer" and one new magic "Gargoyle" to the basic game for each player.
147753.name: Skirmish! The Scrambles: Expansion #1 Antimagic

boardgamecompilation: Skirmish! The Scrambles plus expansions pack
147754.description:
As the monsters aren't really smart, they've just fought straight on. But as they hit their heads against each other, some learned to think.
A valiant warrior, that's a warrior who doesn't rest after a fight, but prepares for the next! But well… sometimes it's a bit too scary so you end up running away instead… meanwhile the others are still fighting!

This 4 cards expansion brings 2 kinds of magic "Return" & "Fear" to the Basic game.
147754.name: Skirmish! The Scrambles: Expansion #2 Breakthrough

boardgamecompilation: The 6 Pack of Paper & Pencil Games
147755.description:
Oil Strike! is played on a board depicting an oil field divided into areas of two, three, and four sites. Players start with one area (size depending on turn order) and claim a new one each turn as long as they last. The other thing a player does on each turn is select one of their sites and roll two dice, with a high enough roll producing oil and a lower roll condemning it to be dry.

Drilling next to producing wells (no matter who owns them) adds a point to the die roll for each such well, making it easier to strike oil. Players can (before rolling the dice) declare that they are going for double or quadruple production, which requires higher rolls.

Players score points for producing wells (more for double or quadruple wells, of course) and bonus points for getting all sites in an area to produce. The first player to reach a target score wins, or the player with the most points if no one manages that.
boardgameversion: 6 Pack of Paper & Pencil Games edition
147755.name: Oil Strike!

boardgamecompilation: 5 Pad & Pencil Games People Love to Play
147756.description: The NineTacToe playsheet depicts nine Tic-Tac-Toe boards with numbers in the spaces; the numbers 1-27 each appear three times throughout the boards. Players take turns choosing a number and marking their symbol in the three spaces where it appears. In effect, each number choice is a play on three of the nine Tic-Tac-Toe games at once. The object is for a player to win a majority of the nine sub-games.
147756.name: NineTacToe

147757.name: Financier
boardgamecompilation: The 6 Pack of Paper & Pencil Games
boardgameversion: 6 Pack of Paper & Pencil Games edition
147757.description:
In Financier (aka A Stock Market Game) players invest in six companies. These companies start with random values (1-6) and on each turn the active player must change the value of one of them by rolling two dice. They must choose one die which represents the company to change, the other die being the amount of the change, and whether the total of the two dice is odd or even determines whether the value goes up or down.

The player can then purchase up to three shares of one of the two companies rolled, using money printed on the gamesheet; no change is given and when it is used up no more purchases can be made.

The object is to have the greatest total share value and capital when the game ends, which happens when a roll can't be used (each company's value can only be changed a fixed number of times).

147758.description: Cards Against Humanity: Reject Pack is a Cards Against Humanity expansion for which each of the creators picked three favorite cards that didn't make it into the final game. The pack contains 16 white cards and 8 black cards, and each card bears a line drawing of one of the creators in the lower right corner.
147758.name: Cards Against Humanity: Reject Pack

147759.name: RE: Your Brains – The Card Game
147759.description:
All a zombie wants is a brain to munch.

Too bad the humans don’t want to give them up. We have all seen it before, the zombie hordes march against the panicked humans. The humans eventually entrench and rally then start blowing away the poor hungry masses of undead. But what if there was a different way? A more civilized way of resolving this tired old conflict? What if we could negotiate instead?

RE: Your Brains is based on the hit song by Jonathan Coulton.

Players take on the roles of the Zombie and the survivor negotiating the brain eating situation. The zombie just wants a hot meal and is trying to convince the survivor to open the door and be that meal, meanwhile the Survivor just wants to go about his life in peace and would love to convince the zombie to go bother some other poor fool, or better yet just stop shambling around all together. To do this players take turns making arguments based on a set of cards in their hands. The only limitation is the mood of the card played, the content is entirely up to the players.

RE: Your Brains is a fast playing two player game that is as much fun to watch as it is to play and you will often get help from the peanut gallery as you try to debate, cajole, and threaten your way to victory.

There are three aspects to playing RE: Your Brains.

1st is the rock, paper, scissors mechanic. There are three types of arguments to be made, Logical, Emotional, and Aggressive, ranging from values of 2-8. Logical arguments get a +2 bonus against Emotional arguments and -2 penalty against Aggressive, Emotional arguments get a +2 bonus against Aggressive and -2 against Logical, and Aggressive arguments get a +2 against Logical and -2 against Emotional. The bonus or penalty applies to the card being played, not the card on the stack. As long as the value is higher with the applied bonus or penalty (or neither if they're the same type of argument), you can play that card in response.

2nd is the roleplaying aspect. Every time you play a card, you must make an argument of the type of argument you played. Hence, if you're the zombie, you might make an 3 value Emotional plea of "We've always been such good friends, and I would hate to have you be ripped to shreds by some other zombies. Let me eat your brain, and I'll turn you into a zombie so we can be friends forever!" and as the survivor you might reply with a 2 value Logical argument which is actually a 4 against the previous 3 emotional and say something like "One would think if you were truly my friend you would defend me from these other zombies, or at the very least stop trying to eat my brain."

3rd is the trick-taking mechanic. To win the game, you must win 5 arguments Each player starts the argument with a hand of 5 cards and uses those cards to make their argument. When they can no longer beat the argument on the table (or if they choose not to), the last person to play a card wins that argument. You may play two cards of the same argument type to overcome an existing argument. If a player completely runs out of cards and has no more to respond to their opponent's argument, they lose.

147760.name: Crazy Machines 1.5
147760.description:
User Summary

Crazy Machines 1.5 is a stand alone sequel to Crazy Machines which uses the same engine and introduces new contraptions.

It contains 2 labs with 100 challenges each. "Inventor's Training Camp" contains 100 easy challenges targetted to children. "New from the Lab" contains 100 new challenges with similar difficulty to the original Crazy Machines Game.

147762.description:
Bolster your armies with The Big Guns, the first expansion for Warmachine: High Command!

The Big Guns contains 5 copies each of 16 different cards, plus 4 additional warcaster cards, to bring new strategies to your Cygnar, Khador, Protectorate of Menoth, and Cryx decks.

Requires Warmachine: High Command core set to play.
147762.name: Warmachine: High Command – The Big Guns

147763.name: Shadowrun - Die 6. Welt
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
147763.description:
user description

This book was poublished in 2005 by Fanpro. It features a comprehensive look at the history, influence and mechanics of Shadowrun from 1989 to date. It includes a collection of articles on Shadowrun-related topics, short stories and a collector's guide listing all Shadowrun publications and novels in English and German.

147764.name: Magische Zeiten
rpgcategory: Non-Rankable Item (item will not show in the rankings)
147764.description:
User description

This book was poublished in 2004 by Fanpro. It features a comprehensive look at the history, influence and mechanics of Das Schwarze Auge from 1984 to date. It includes a collection of articles on DSA-related topics, short stories and a collector's guide listing all Schwarze Auge publications and novels in German.

147765.description: The game takes a few rounds. In each round, all the players close their eyes except the single player. He turns on one of the selected tiles with cookies (tiles are double-sided, on each side there is another cookie). The players then open their eyes and have to point with the finger which cookie is new on the table. The first player who do this correctly will receive 2 points. Also players will have to remembers of what colour and shape had cookie which is missing. Each player have a change to receive points for remembering those two features. There is 16 cakes with 4 colours and 4 different shapes. After four round who will have to most points is the winner.
147765.name: Znikające ciasteczka
boardgamefamily: Egmont Polska "Dobra gra w dobrej cenie" series

147766.name: Das grosse Nibelungen-Spielbuch
147766.description:
User description

Released by Bastei in 1985, "Das grosse Nibelungen-Spielbuch" (the big Nibelung game book) is the first adventure game book published in German originally instead of being a translation of Fighting Fantasy or Lone Wolf.
In it the player can replay the the Nibelung saga as Siegfried.

147767.name: The Planewalker's Codex (Issue 1 - Spring 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Faces from Across the Planes: Interview with Shemmy
Killing the Lady of Pain: Part 1
147767.description:
From the Publisher's Website:

This new magazine is inspired by a new influx of planar gaming materials including Paizo's Book of the Damned and Open Design's Dark Roads and Golden Hells (both of Planewalker's managers and numerous denizens of our forums contributed to the latter).

We hope that this not only encourages discussion about the Planescape and planar campaigns in general, but also to explore topics long held to be taboo. In the spirit of pushing the boundaries this issue kicks off with a look at the biggest taboo in the setting: Killing the Lady of Pain.

147768.description:
Five Cucumbers is a trick-taking game with the goal of NOT winning the last trick!

It's not easy. You have two choices on your turn: Take over a trick by playing a equal or higher card or you must play your lowest card. It is not enough to keep a low card in your hand for the last trick as you will also need some high cards for taking over key tricks.

The player who wins the final (seventh) trick screwed up and must take cucumbers. Each player collects their cucumbers at the end of a round, and if a player has more than five cucumbers, he is out of the game; five cucumbers is the most you can have! In this way more and more players are excluded from the game until the final two are playing for victory!

Five Cucumbers is a modern variant of the trick-taking game Agurk, which is well-known primarily in Scandinavia. We are excited to bring you our new version!
147768.name: Five Cucumbers
boardgamepodcastepisode: What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 83!

147769.name: The Complete Post-Apocalyptic Scavenger's Field Guide
147769.description:
user summary:
This is a fan-made sourcebook compiling equipment lists, details, statistics and new rules for Gamma World (1st Edition) and Gamma World (2nd Edition).

from the Foreword:
Welcome to the Complete Post-Apocalyptic Scavenger’s Field Guide, the second in the DeEvolution series of 1st/2nd edition Gamma World netbook supplements. In compiling the equipment from across so many editions and sources, I’ve tried to put together the Gamma World supplement I’ve always wanted to have on MY bookshelf next to the Basic Rules Booklet. No more searching through a dozen out-of-print modules and magazines just to find an artifact, no more cross-referencing between two books to find the REST of the stats. This is Gamma World the way it should be. If you’re the gearhead Gamma Merigan type, check out the rules for constructing robots and power armor. If you’re a Game Master looking to give your game that “Modern Primitive” touch, check out the updated and expanded low tech weapons and armor. No longer is a club just a piece of wood in this wasteland! Lastly, players and GM’s alike will get just the facts they need from the comprehensive equipment listings, all indexed for quick reference. So,next time you’re taking a roadtrip into the Deathlands, remember to have the Field Guide handy, keep your Mark V warm, and don’t eat the glowing snow.

147770.name: Where's My Water? 2
videogamehonor: 2013 Games Magazine Best New Mobile/Handheld Game Winner
147770.description:
Get ready to join Swampy, Allie, and Cranky on their NEXT exciting adventure! Where’s My Water? 2 launches with three brand new locations including the Sewer, the Soap Factory, and the Beach. Best of all, the puzzles are free! Cut through dirt, and guide fresh water, purple water, and steam to help Swampy and his friends!

Source: The Game Website.

147771.name: Exotic Encounters: Wraiths
147771.description:
From publisher blurb:

This particular installment of Exotic Encounters focuses on the wraith. While the numerous spectral undead can be somewhat difficult to keep track of (the category includes, but is not limited to, allips, banshees, ghosts, poltergeists, shadows, spectres, and wraiths), each of the wraiths in this tome is formed when a creature dies under certain circumstances, and is animated by the rage or despair surrounding the circumstances of its death. The first wraith in the book, the plague wraith (CR 7), is created by plague victims who are shut away and left to die by the healthy. They carry a number of deadly diseases, including the dreaded wraith’s wasting, which slowly transforms the victim into a plague wraith himself, and they can possess the bodies of those suffering from diseases. The second wraith is the lifedrinker wraith (CR 9), whose touch instills a deadly curse that blocks healing, and which can drain the life force from victims in a 30-ft.-cone. Finally, there is the doom wraith (CR 14), which spawns large number of standard wraiths from the creatures it kills, and can leave foes in an apathetic stupor, though it can be fought by the power of concentrated hope and goodwill.

147772.name: Mutant Manual II
147772.description:
from the Foreword:
Too many editions of Gamma World means there are too many different ways to invent, quantify,and describe. At least until now. The Gamma World DeEvolution series of netbooks takes the whole lot of it and sends it back to the Stone Age of 1st/2nd edition gaming . And in this, the Mutant Manual II , you can find nearly every one of the published creatures and many of the homebrew mutants as well. You’ll find more than 150 new creatures, from giant carnivorous ants to talking mushrooms and everything in between. And all of them in 2nd edition format. As the most popular, easy to use, and most importantly, easy to modify of all the various editions , the creatures and statistics presented inside are both concise and easy to adapt to your own gaming , while keeping the original descriptions intact. Enjoy. And don’t let the Vath catch you napping!

147773.name: 20 Variant Foes: Red Dragons
147773.description:
From publisher blurb:

Make Red Dragons Rule Anew.

20 Variant Foes: Red Dragons saves you time while instilling a sense of dread and the wonder of the unknown back into the game, even for those jaded players who have memorized the Bestiary. It cover 20 different variants for each CR ranging from 3 to 30, making it useful for Game Masters at all levels of play.

Encounter crimson tyrants of the crags such as the feral young red dragon the locals name The Beast of Savage Fire; challenge the advanced hellfire old red dragon Omug, The All-Consuming Flame; or end your days fighting the divine ravener, ancient red dragon, and divine channeler Unja the Undying Fire!

From the lowliest unhinged wyrmling red dragon to an accelerated bipedal dread mummy undead lord very young red dragon diviner 11/loremaster 10, you will find the complex stat blocks you have come to expect from Justin P. Sluder who helped bringing you the statblocks for the Faces of the Tarnished Souk series.

147774.name: #30 More Manuals of Improvement
147774.description:
From publisher blurb:

"It’s a lot more than a self-help book!"

More than knowledge lies within these pages, waiting within lies talent.

Within you will find grimoires such a “Abstruse Arcane Augmentation!” that can imbue a gift for metamagic; “Cultivating Your Talents” a book that enhances one’s rogue class features; and “Hair Pulling, Sand Throwing, and Other Dirty Tricks” teaches you underhanded combat maneuvers.

Get more than just information, go beyond your limitations with #30 More Manuals of Improvement!

147775.name: Topfrosch
147775.description:
Topfrosch consists of a wooden frame, four frogs (made from coconut halves), a sand timer, and 160 marbles in four colors. Marbles represent the insects that the frogs want to catch.

Set the frame on the table, place the marbles inside, then flip the sand timer. Each player grabs his frog and pushes it through the arena, trying to get as many marbles as possible under the frog before the 30-second timer runs out.
Topfrosch includes various scoring versions: In the kids' version, each marble counts one point. For adults, each color counts only for one player/team, while other colors are deducted. In some versions, one color counts for everyone, etc. Whoever has the most points after a round wins.

147776.name: Die Glocke
147776.description:
From publisher blurb:

According to the legend, in 1944 the SS built a mysterious device deep in a Silesian mine shaft. Its bell-like shape gave it the nickname “die Glocke,” or “the Bell,” but the purpose of “Project Lantern-Bearer” remains a mystery to this day. Was it a time machine? A zero-point energy generator? A gateway to another world? Die Glocke cuts through the legend to the truth — and then piles on a bunch more legend. Plus, a look at “die Glocke” as a NIGHT’S BLACK AGENTS node, a TRAIL OF CTHULHU seed, or a ESOTERRORIST black site

147777.name: Hideous Creatures: Mi-Go
147777.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this series, Kenneth Hite looks at the creatures, species, and monsters of the Cthulhu Mythos from every non-Euclidean angle. Alternate versions and new explanations provide the same jolt of mythic bisociation that the gods and titans receive in the TRAIL OF CTHULHU corebook. Hite traces these foul things through their legendary history, and provides further clues for any Investigator to follow. Horrific scenario seeds burst and bloom, story spines protrude and deform, in a blasphemous garden any Keeper can harvest.

“As to what the things were — explanations naturally varied.” So are described the Mi-Go, the fungi from Yuggoth, the half-crustacean haunters of the hillside, the malevolent alien miners … are also opponents of the Yellow Sign and tireless questers for science. And that’s just one story! Are they servants of Nyarlathotep or fellow sentients trapped in a hellish cosmos? Listen for their whispers in tales of kobolds and kallikanzarai, look for their traces in Himalayan snows and heartland crop circles.

147778.name: The Aces of the People's Paradise of Africa, Part 1
147778.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Aces of the People's Paradise of Africa, Part 1

The Wild Card has rewritten the map in many ways, nowhere more so than Africa, where the Caliphate rules the Middle East and the new "People's Paradise" dominates central Africa through the ruthless cunning of its rulers and the aid of the rebel ace Tom Weathers and the mysterious Leopard Men.

147779.name: The Aces of the People's Paradise of Africa, Part 2
147779.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Aces of the People's Paradise of Africa, Part 2

The innocent are often the ones who suffer most in war, and particularly the children, none more so than the ace child soldiers of the "People’s Paradise of Africa," products of a secret project to expose subjects to the wild card virus in hopes of creating a super-powered army of loyal soldiers. These are the successes, so just imagine the fate of the failures...

147780.name: Gadget Guide: Biotech
147780.description:
From publisher blurb:

Each Gadget Guide in the series takes a look at a particular type of devices in Mutants & Masterminds game terms, putting together the effects and modifiers from the Hero's Handbook to present different a wide variety of gadgets of that type. It also looks at specific concepts related to creating and using those devices in play. The Guide is a catalog of ready to use toys for your M&M game!


Biotech

Medical science has long sought ways to cure, heal, and improve the human condition, but the knowledge to heal also comes with the knowledge to harm, and the science of improving life can also twist it in a variety of ways. Biotech looks at biological technology, from cloning and genetic engineering to biometrics, forensics, bio-modification, biological equipment, and biochemicals.

147781.name: Roolipelaaja (Issue 18 - Nov 2008)
147781.description: The theme of this issue is religion, mostly concentrating on Christianity and also pondering about Jesus as an RPG character.

147782.description:
Carcassonne is a tile-placement game in which the players draw and place a tile with a piece of southern French landscape on it. The tile might feature a city, a road, a cloister, grassland or some combination thereof, and it must be placed adjacent to tiles that have already been played, in such a way that cities are connected to cities, roads to roads, etcetera. Having placed a tile, the player can then decide to place one of his meeples on one of the areas on it: on the city as a knight, on the road as a robber, on a cloister as a monk, or on the grass as a farmer. When that area is complete, that meeple scores points for its owner.

During a game of Carcassonne, players are faced with decisions like: "Is it really worth putting my last meeple there?" or "Should I use this tile to expand my city, or should I place it near my opponent instead, giving him a hard time to complete his project and score points?" Since players place only one tile and have the option to place one meeple on it, turns proceed quickly even if it is a game full of options and possibilities.

This special edition is sold exclusively by the German trade company Müller. It comes in a similar metal box as previous special editions and contains the Carcassonne base game along with the expansion set Carcassonne: Count, King & Robber and Die Belagerer which is a new six-tile version of Carcassonne: Die Katharer (with new graphics but similar to the Rio Grande Games (2008) release).
147782.name: Carcassonne Müller Exklusiv-Edition

147783.name: AGE Bestiary: Beastmen
147783.description:
From publisher's website:

Strange mixtures of animal and beast, the idea of the bestial humanoid who combines human cunning and animal ferocity can be found in numerous cultures and entertainment media. From heroic half-animal men to hungry tribes of man killing beasts, they can be a serious threat or unusual ally to many adventurers. Includes cute and furry and dangerous beastmen, centaurs, fish men, minotaurs, and reptile men, and rules for cursed and tribal beastmen.

147786.name: The Tome of Horrors 4 (Pathfinder)
147786.description:
From publisher blurb:

This massive tome of never before seen monsters will be done in our characteristic textbook bound hardcover style, but this time in full color! Featuring over 300 new monsters from our design team led by Scott Greene and illustrated by Chris McFann, it provides new fiends to terrorize your players with for years to come. Both Swords & Wizardry and Pathfinder versions available.

One can simply never have enough monsters. The greatest trick a GM can play is to show up with something new that the players have never heard of before. Anyone who has been doing this for very long knows the drill, “Goblins, ok, fighters to the front so they get multiple attacks”, or “a troll! Get fire and acid ready!”.

Imagine what happened to the first group of players that encountered a nilbog—and watched it grow in size as the fighters each hit it 5 times. What about a pyrohydra—fire had no way to stop it from growing new heads… “Oh my, what do we do now?” may have been the next battlecry.

It’s not always necessary to make every monster a death-dealing enigma; however fear of the unknown is one of the strongest tools in the GM’s arsenal. It keeps players on their toes and makes the game more fun. Certainly the old mundane standbys need a place at the table (and the miniature case); after all, what is a dungeon without a troll or ten?

147787.name: Evil Wizards in a Cave
147787.description:
From the back cover:


The Tellurine Monastery has a serious problem—a band of evil wizards have stolen their holiest relic, the helmet of Saint Anglard, and fled. The abbot believes they are hiding out in one of the region’s many caves, judging by the recent increase in weird occurrences. But can he find a group of adventurous mercenaries who won’t be distracted?


This sandbox adventure offers more than just a quest! Dragons prowl the valley, a beastman is on the loose, and there are tales of a haunted house up in the mountains somewhere, full of treasure. What sort of trouble will you get up to here?

147788.name: Back Up!
147788.description:
In Back Up! the object is to reduce your back pain to zero. Each turn, players pick up a card from the deck and discard, while trying to collect HEALTH cards in their hand. HEALTH cards reduce your pain, while PAIN cards increase it. ACTION cards allow players to take cards from other players, discard cards, or draw extra cards from the deck. Finally, some HEALTH cards cannot be played without a MONEY or INSURANCE card.

Players start with 5 cards, but the ACTION cards change the number of cards in your hand. Sometimes you are forced to discard cards that you need. The rules are simple, but the ACTION cards add a layer of strategy. It has a light humorous feel. There are 68 cards in a deck.

147789.name: Conan, the Boy in Future
147789.description:
User summary:

A 3D cell-shaded action game based on the legendary TV-series with the same name. The game is divided into the "Lost Island", "Industria" and "Giganto" parts.

147790.description:
Sail your fleet of galleons to the Murky Isles, hiding place for some of the greatest pirate treasures ever buried. Roll the Buccaneer Bones (landlubbers call them "dice") to send ships out to sea. When you reach the island, you get a special bonus just for being there. But the best part is the treasure! Find the treasure and bring it back to port, then set sail again. The first pirate to bring back three treasures claims the title of "Scourge of the Seven Seas"! Arrrr!!!

Each player in Buccaneer Bones starts with six ships on the six numbered ports of his player mat; each ship is in a sailing lane that consists of a port, a sea space, and an island. On a turn, the player rolls four dice, then rerolls as many as he wants; if he now has a pair, he advances the ship matching the number rolled one space (from port to sea or from sea to island) and if he has a three-of-a-kind, he advances the appropriate ship two spaces (from port to island). When a player has a ship on an island, he receives a bonus:


When on islands 1 or 6, he rolls one extra die; on islands 1 and 6, he rolls two extra dice.
When on islands 2 or 5, he can add or subtract one from a rolled die; on islands 2 and 5, he can do this twice.
When on islands 3 or 4, he can reroll any number of dice one extra time; on islands 3 and 4, he can reroll two extra times.


When a player has a ship on an island, if he has a three-of-a-kind matching that island number, the ship grabs one treasure, then returns to port.

If a player can't advance a ship, he can place his first mate (1) as a scout on an island to grant himself that power on his next turn, (2) as a thief on a treasure owned by a player with more treasure than him, giving him a chance to steal it next turn if he rolls any three-of-a-kind, or (3) as a defender to remove a thief on one of his treasures.

The game ends the round that a player collects his third treasure. If he's the only one with three treasures, he wins; if multiple players have three, then the tied player who has more ships farther from his ports wins.

Buccaneer Bones includes a couple of play variants, including rules for a solo game.
147790.name: Buccaneer Bones

147791.name: Puyo Puyo!! Puyo Puyo 20th anniversary
147791.description:
User summary:

A collection of Puyo games to celebrate the 20th anniversary of the series. Not regarded as a numbered game in the main series of the games, it's a collection of modes where you can choose anything from the first game to Puyo Puyo Fever, puzzles to solve and several different others.

147792.name: Misa no Mahomonogatari
147792.description:
User summary

A "parenting simulator", typical to the Princess Maker theme, in "Misas magic story" the player is to steer the 11-year old Misa into becoming a full-fledged idol and magical girl.

Depending on the player's choices, the scenarios during the second part of the game change, making Misa either a love bird, an adventurer, and idol or a fighter for justice.

147793.name: Nine Holes
boardgamepublisher: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC
147793.description:
Nine Holes is played on a 3x3 square grid in which the spaces have three different colors. Each player has three pieces which start off the board. Players take turns entering the pieces on the board and then (assuming no one has won) moving a piece to an adjacent space (including diagonally).

The object is to get all three of one's pieces into an orthogonal line or on all three spaces of one color.

147794.name: Chase
boardgamepublisher: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC
147794.description: Chase is played on a Backgammon board and uses similar movement rules. However, the setup is different and the object of the game is completely different; the winner is the player who captures all of the opposing pieces. Consequently, there is no bearing off (the board is a continuous loop) and captured pieces cannot be re-entered.

147795.name: Heroes of Metro City: Powers and Enemies
147795.description:
This is a 25 card Kickstarter-Only promotional set called "Powers and Enemies" available to backers at the "A HERO IS BORN – COMPLETE" or higher level.

There are a variety of cards in the pack, for example a Power card called "Kickstarted Super-Cycle" that, for 2, gives "Revved Up: Once activated, this card is an Energy Source for Travel and Wild Powers", and for 4, gives "Gain +1 Plot Point".

147796.description:
The Heroes of Metro City: Sidekicks and Storylines expansion adds new Sidekick Power cards to the City Supply and includes expansion rules for creating a Storyline Deck in the City Supply that will expand on your Hero's legend, both in the past and present!

Ever wanted to make your OWN Super-Powered Hero from the ground up? In Heroes of Metro City, YOU get to pick your Hero's powers, craft an origin story and then start kicking some evil villainous butt! Make a hero in just a few minutes and start battling an Archenemy and his army of henchmen who are out to destroy your beloved city.

In the Sidekicks and Storylines expansion, 160 new cards are added to the mix. There are 7 new Power cards, such as the electrifying Charged Grip which delivers more damage the more you build up your Energy first. It also contains 3 new Energy Sources, such as Metamorphosis, which rewards you with Plot Points (the game's currency) when you use energy-supplying Power cards (like Martial Arts Mastery or Accelerating Superspeed). Perhaps you're looking for more Archenemies to fight? Sidekicks and Storylines has three new terrifying masterminds of evil, including the murderous Killswitch Supreme, a cold fusion-powered cyborg who is only weakened when the Heroic team (that's you) fights as one.
147796.name: Heroes of Metro City: Sidekicks and Storylines
boardgamepodcastepisode: House Rules 79: Interview with David Boostrum on Heroes of Metro City

147797.name: Robot Commando
147797.description:
Robot Commando (ロボコマ) is combat game for 2 players. Before fighting, each player make one's combat robot by combination of cards. Card has Three types of the Robot, Ability and Arms.

First, the player choose a Robot card. Player get Ability cards set and any Armed cards by the Robot. Equipped with Arms is limited by weight and shape.
Cards become commands for maneuver of Robot. And a card is 1 Hit Points. The damage decreases battle performance of the Robot and will destroy it.

By original card plot system, this game will not roll the dice for damage and decisions hit. The rule is simple, but game is technical and tactical.

This is indies game.

147799.description:
An LPS bonus mini-game.

"World War II has broken out and a single German pocket battleship is supremely poised amid Allied shipping lanes to completely disrupt Allied naval preparations. Can a single ship, at once so powerful it can crush any convoy escort encountered, and so fast it can evade any more powerful force sent to sink it, succeed and vindicate the concept? Find out with this exciting game!"

Hunt for the Graf Spee is an hex and counter game for two players. The British Player will try to locate and sink the Graf Spee. The German Player, whose sole unit it is, will try to locate and sink British Shipping while avoiding destruction. Movement is secretly plotted and units are placed on map after being successfully searched for. There is a small tactical subsystem to handle naval combat, similar to Minden Games Salvo (ships are firing full broadsides and maintaining range, or firing half broadsides and changing range)
147799.name: Hunt for the Graf Spee

147801.name: Rule One (Issue 9 - Summer 2011)
147801.description:
From the official website:

Iskallor describes the area of the Elder Wilds known as Zong's Knuckles; Greg Stafford gives us a look at myths about the Plant Kingdom; Roderick Robertson shares the Badraie Frog People, a minor race; David Millians writes about the foreigners in Kralori society in the Pus-Ridden Devils, Andrew Larson gives us his view of life in Prax, and Calithena and Steve Marsh look at using Heroquests in your game.

147802.name: Rule One (Issue 10 - Autumn 2011)
rpgissuearticle: Wuyani: Children of the Vulture God
147802.description:
In this Issue:

Articles by Andrew Larsen, John Harding, Roderick Robertson, David Millians, Greg Stafford, Hervé Carteau and Chris Bell.

147803.name: Rule One (Issue 11 - Winter 2012)
147803.description:
From the official website:

Continuing his exploration of Kralorela, David Millians tells us of the Baboons of Kralorela; We present Greg Stafford's Lives of Sedenya, part 3 (the final chapter will be in Issue 12). Roderick Robertson gives us three articles on the Oslir and those that live and work on him/her; Andrew Larsen describes some of the lesser-known flora, fauna and spirits of Prax, and we have not one, but two articles on Votankiland: a clan generator from Keith Nellist, and what Oliver Bernuetz promises will be the first in a series of adventures Taming Votankiland (any contradiction between the two articles is up to you to decide!)

147806.name: Ehdrigohr Core Rulebook
147806.description:
From the back of the book

Welcome to Ehdrigohr and may the crows be your guides!

Ehdrigohr is a land where the nine tribes must survive the terrible things that walk the lands from sundown to sunrise. Immerse yourself in a fantastic world of cultures, myths, and legends. Magic is everywhere and with it the people can bend reality to their will or break it and unleash even more terrible things trapped in the emptiness called the Twain.

Ehdrigohr is a roleplaying game focused around storytelling, high drama, and horror. Players will create heroes and heroines who hold back the tides so the people can see another day.

Powered by Fate.

[Taken from introductory and site text.]
In Ehdrigohr, tribal people in a broken world strive to unify while struggling against the horrors that wait for the night to fall.

Ehdrigohr is a Fate Core System based tabletop role-playing game. It is inspired from the mythology and lore of tribal peoples from across the world but has a particular foundation inspired from Lakotah stories and folklore.

In Ehdrigohr you get to play a character struggling to survive in this recovering world. It is a fantasy game of high heroics, myth and culture, powerful magic, and survival horror. The tides of darkness are overwhelming but this is not meant to be a game of nihilism. It is about hope. Your characters are the mythic heroes who do impossible things that push back the terrible tide.

There are multitudes of paths to greatness.

A warrior, imbued with mystic martial arts who fights on The Line?
A storyteller who keeps the peoples' spirits up and empowers their hearts to fight another day.
A wandering peacekeeper that ferrets out the infiltrators and hatemongers who work to break the nations.
A reality weaving Way-walker who travels the wild places seeking the breaches where the creatures trapped in the Twain have broken through the pale into the world.




Culturally, Ehdrigohr is a non-traditional fantasy world. Rather than fantasy seen through a Euro-Medieval lens, Ehdrigohr is instead crafted to take inspiration from the myth and folklore of tribal, and indigenous, cultures around the world with particular inspiration from traditions of the Lakhota people.

Though it is a human-centric world, each of the cultures of Ehdrigohr promises to have its own flavor steeped in magic. These are not “primitive” cultures but nations that have chosen their own interesting paths and traditions in their effort to survive the ravenous hordes that come in the night. Though it presents a different flavor of fantasy, there is a point of entry for many styles of play. There is high adventure, political intrigue, delving, social plays, secret societies, monster bashing, monster fleeing, and so on.

Mechanically, Ehdrigohr relies on the Fate Core system to deliver its fun and focus on dramatic storytelling. The mechanics have been tailored to the ideals of the setting, though you can still expand on it with ideas from other FATE-based games out there in the market.

In addition to being a fun game and an interesting world to explore Ehdrigohr is also a game of allegories. It examines our relationships with each other and the powerful force that is depression and how it whittles away at us, sending terrible thoughts that come when we are in dark places, bring us shivers, and cause us to fade. We hope to inspire people to hold strong in the darkness and fight your way through to a new light.

So please join us. Make a character, choose your place, and hold the line in the night.

147807.name: Santa Claus Game
147807.description: Parker Brothers' Santa Claus Game consists of a simple race game governed by a spinner. Holiday themed toys and games appealed to present-buying adults during the holiday season. The first player, who cross finish line wins the game.

147809.description:
The wind is in your favor this season! This one-card mini-expansion for Koi Pond doubles the value of one color of koi! Watch out, because your opponents have their own valuable koi, too! Add this card to your existing Koi Pond game for fun new strategies!

How to add this to Koi Pond:
While setting up the game, place this card faced-up in the middle of the play area. Orient it so that each suit icon faces one player. (In a 2-player or 3 player game, some suits will go unclaimed.)

The following rule will be in effect during the whole game:
You score double points for koi of the suit facing you.
147809.name: Koi Pond: Four Winds
boardgameexpansion: Koi Pond: A Coy Card Game

147810.description:
Protect your koi pond from those pesky turtles, cranes and housecats! This one-card mini-expansion for KOI POND grants you immunity from some of these nasty pests. Watch out, because your opponents have their own immunity, too! Add this card to your existing Koi Pond game for fun new strategies!

How to add this to Koi Pond:
While setting up the game, place this card in the middle of the play area. Orient it so that each suit icon faces one player. (In a 2-player or a 3-player game, some suits will go onclaimed.)

The following rule will be in effect during the whole game.

Your opponents cannot use turtles, cranes or housecats to score points from your koi of the suit facinc you.
147810.name: Koi Pond: Four Walls
boardgameexpansion: Koi Pond: A Coy Card Game

147811.name: Mephisto (Issue 43 - Jan/Feb 2009)
rpgissuearticle: Wenn mir nicht die eigene Angst in die Quere käme...
147811.description:
User description

Issue 43 of Mephisto magazine.

Includes three additional seperate publications:
- Tabletop Insider #1
- Späte Post (Schwarze Auge adventure)
- Zerbrochene Hoffnung (Dark Heresy quick-start rules)

147812.name: Wellspring
147812.description:
From the Weird Wars Rome Kickstarter:

The date is 166 AD. The location is Fort Aesica, Hadrian's Wall.

Legio IX is besieged. The Pictish barbarians maintain a constant assault by day and night. The walls are crumbling and food is running low. No help is coming. The legion must hold, or die.

There seems no end to the attackers or their strange, phenomenal strength. But where does this power come from? The centurion comes up with a desperate gamble. Your contubernium must break out from the siege and discover the source of their power. Your shield mates depend on it. You depend on it. Strength and honor. Victory or death.

Wellspring is a 12-page, full-color, fully-illustrated adventure for Weird Wars Rome.

147813.name: Mephisto (Issue 44 - Apr/May 2009)
rpgissuearticle: "Schon als Kind haben mich Landkarten inspiriert..."
Die Akademie der geistigen Kraft zu Fasar
147813.description:
User description

Issue 44 of Mephisto magazine.
Includes two additional seperate publications:
- Falkengrunds letzte Hoffnung, Pathfinder RPG scenario
- LARP: Rollenspiel hautnah (LARP magazine)

147814.name: The Hydra
147814.description:
From the Weird Wars Rome Kickstarter:

Statistics for different types of the beast including the EPIC and legendary Lernaen Hydra! War Masters also get a bundle of adventure seeds and Figure Flats for the beasts to torment your party with.

147815.name: Mephisto (Issue 45 - Jul/Aug 2009)
rpgissuearticle: "Die Lust auf Abwechslung hat eine große Rolle gespielt."
"Phantasie ist eine treibende Kraft in unserem Dasein..."
Die Geister, die man ruft - Teil 2
147815.description:
User description

Issue 45 of Mephisto magazine.
Includes one additional seperate publication:
- Die Druiden (Comic reading sample)

147816.name: Mephisto (Issue 46 - Oct/Nov 2009)
rpgissuearticle: "In guten Büchern geht es immer um Grenzerfahrungen"
"Trolle sind möglicherweise eine weitere Forschungsreise wert!"

147817.name: Rule One (Issue 12 - Spring 2012)
147817.description:
In this Issue:

Articles by Andrew Larsen, Roderick Robertson, David Millians, Nicholas Never, Greg Stafford, Stewart Stansfield and Oliver Bernuetz

147818.name: Rule One (Issue 13 - Summer 2012)
147818.description:
From the official website:

This issue we have the first of a three-part article from Gianni Vacca on using the Tunnels and Trolls system in Glorantha; Andrew Larson presents the Praxian oasis of Agape, and also a look at Praxian Greeting Contests; David Millians continues his survey of Kralorela with a description of the province of Boshan; Jamie 'Trotsky' Revell gives us the Order of St. Josselynne, Oliver Berneutz outlines the game of Shieldpush and gives us a set of rules for table-top play; and Roderick Robertson presents a bit of Plunder: the Godlearner Tarot. We have not one, but two downloads this time: Oliver's Shieldpush game, and Roderick's Tarot deck.

147819.name: Company Leader
147819.description:
Company Leader is a company level based wargame, meaning that players are playing with company sized playing pieces. As a commanding officer you try to win the battlefield by scouting and destroying the enemy and by capturing urban areas.

Company Leader is not meant as a simulation of statistics, but as a game in which you are challenged to take the right tactical decisions in order to win. Therefore, the aim is for fairly simple rules. The game focuses on scouting, concealing and movement of your troops.

Fog of war is the root of Company Leader and this is symbolized by gaming pieces on the game board. At the start of the game your troops are not visible to the enemy, neither can you see his. You will have to scout to reveal them and keep scouting to prevent them from hiding again.

147820.name: Rule One (Issue 14 - Autumn 2012)
rpgissuearticle: The Cult of the Seven Mothers
The Three Little Sundomers and the Big Bad Orlanthi
147820.description:
From the official website:

This issue has another boardgame by Keith Nellist - The Nights of Horror, based on the Dragon Pass boardgame; the second part of Gianni Vacca's Timinits and Trolls rules mofifications for Tunnels and Trolls; Richard Crawley returns with a look at skirmish wargaming with the Song of Blades and Heroes ruleset; Chris Bell gives us a RuneQuest 6 version of the 7 Mother's Cult; Jane Williams delights us with a story about the Three Little Sundomers and the Big, Bad Orlanthi, and finally Andrew larsen gives us an adventure set in a Praxian oasis - the Belly of the Beast, with lots of Brooish goodness. And, for the first time, I have no article in the issue!

147821.name: Rule One (Issue 15 - Winter 2013)
147821.description:
In this Issue:

Articles by Andrew Larsen, Gianni Vacca, David Millians and Jane Williams.

147822.name: 1862: Malvern Hill (American Civil War in 3D)
147822.description:
Malvern Hill is the seventeenth battle in the series and is the seventh in our Peninsula Campaign set of 1862. The Confederates have attacked the Union army at Glendale and they have again retreated south to Malvern Hill.

Combat is designed around the three factors that appear on the unit counters; these indicate the Range, Attack and Strength of the represented unit. You don’t even need any dice to play the game since a dice tile system is included with the game, but if you want to roll dice then it’s the simple six sided variety that you will require.

The game board is designed to be used either 2 dimensionally as a straight print and play or 3 dimensionally, this takes a little more time to construct but it is well worth the effort for the impressive game board you get at its completion. The final 3D game board gives a realistic feel to the terrain and shows the tactical dispositions of all the game counters.

147823.name: City of Brass: a game of colonial exploration (Game Chef 2005 edition)
rpg: City of Brass: a game of colonial exploration
147823.description:
from the introduction:
The Expedition Afrique

In 1892, the French led a military campaign in Dahomey, the "Slave Coast" between Nigeria and Togo, against its kings so that they might have control of Porto Novo, a coastal city. They marched all the way to Abomey, the capital of the land, and found the rulers gone. They amused themselves by looting the city for souvenirs. The French press was most impressed by a white parasol decorated with human jawbones.

They never saw the inside of that parasol. Inside it was a map drawn in human blood, a map that pointed to a legendary city deep in Africa's interior. This city was called the City of Brass, a bastion of ancient African civilization full of treasure, both gold and knowledge. Sadi Carnot, the president of France, sent a expedition on that doomed journey. It only took three weeks for them to become hopelessly lost in an uncharted land. To this day, no one knows what happened to them. According to legend, only one of them made it, and his greatest wishes were given unto him.

In this game, you will play those lost souls. Trapped in Africa's interior, with a map drawn on a parasol and not enough resources, you search.

A note about the content of this game

This game was done in one week with minimal research. In addition, while there is no magic in this game, it is a fantasy. The nobility found among the people of Africa is not balanced against the savagery found here. Like all peoples, the historic Africans had both high nobility and awful destruction found in them. Even though this game depicts the negative side of culture disproportionally, the author is fully aware that is not the only side, or even the dominant side.

147824.name: TF22 Mine
147824.description:
It's the year 2124. Energy has become a rare commodity as a consequence of the industrialization of our universe. One of the main energy sources is White Ranium. The large energy companies can hardly find new planets with the raw material, and heavy-duty surface scanners are employed to search for a worthwhile volume of the energy source in the few Ranium mines already known.

Now the Mega Group Troll Factory Unlimited has found some on planet GH-328. Several rival mine crews have been sent to the mine to find the White Ranium and transport it to the space loader — but the material isn't secure until it arrives at the space loader. Until then it can be intercepted by the other mine crews.

In TF22 Mine, each player takes the part of one mine crew, collects White Ranium in the mine, and transports it to the space loader. Each space loader can load up to two units of White Ranium. The mine crew must then return to the base camp in the middle of the mine to recharge their equipment. After that, they can send more units of White Ranium to the space loader. The crew then uses the molecular transporter of the space loader for transport to the base camp.

The player who first transports three units of White Ranium to the space loader wins.

147825.name: Rollenspiel: Eine Vorstellung
147825.description:
User description

Short, introductory rules for immediate play with inexperienced players.

147826.name: Unità di Soccorso Giapponesi
147826.description:
